      • findLastOperator

        public static <T> T findLastOperator(Operator<?> op,
                                     Class<T> clazz)
        Starting at the input operator, finds the last operator in the stream that is an instance of the input class.
        Parameters:
        op - the starting operator
        clazz - the class that the operator that we are looking for instantiates
        Returns:
        null if no such operator exists or multiple branches are found in the stream, the last operator otherwise

      • iterateParents

        public static void iterateParents(Operator<?> operator,
                                  NodeUtils.Function<Operator<?>> function)

      • classifyOperators

        public static com.google.common.collect.Multimap<Class<? extends Operator<?>>,Operator<?>> classifyOperators(Operator<?> start,
                                                                                                             Set<Class<? extends Operator<?>>> classes)
        Given an operator and a set of classes, it classifies the operators it finds in the stream depending on the classes they instantiate. If a given operator object is an instance of more than one of the input classes, e.g. the operator instantiates one of the classes in the input set that is a subclass of another class in the set, the operator will be associated to both classes in the output map.
        Parameters:
        start - the start operator
        classes - the set of classes
        Returns:
        a multimap from each of the classes to the operators that instantiate them

      • classifyOperatorsUpstream

        public static com.google.common.collect.Multimap<Class<? extends Operator<?>>,Operator<?>> classifyOperatorsUpstream(Operator<?> start,
                                                                                                                     Set<Class<? extends Operator<?>>> classes)
        Given an operator and a set of classes, it classifies the operators it finds upstream depending on the classes it instantiates. If a given operator object is an instance of more than one of the input classes, e.g. the operator instantiates one of the classes in the input set that is a subclass of another class in the set, the operator will be associated to both classes in the output map.
        Parameters:
        start - the start operator
        classes - the set of classes
        Returns:
        a multimap from each of the classes to the operators that instantiate them

      • countOperatorsUpstream

        public static int countOperatorsUpstream(Operator<?> start,
                                         Set<Class<? extends Operator<?>>> classes)
        Given an operator and a set of classes, it returns the number of operators it finds upstream that instantiate any of the given classes.
        Parameters:
        start - the start operator
        classes - the set of classes
        Returns:
        the number of operators

      • setMemoryAvailable

        public static void setMemoryAvailable(List<Operator<? extends OperatorDesc>> operators,
                                      long memoryAvailableToTask)

      • findRoots

        public static void findRoots(Operator<?> op,
                             Collection<Operator<?>> roots)
        Given the input operator 'op', walk up the operator tree from 'op', and collect all the roots that can be reached from it. The results are stored in 'roots'.

      • removeBranch

        public static void removeBranch(SparkPartitionPruningSinkOperator op)
        Remove the branch that contains the specified operator. Do nothing if there's no branching, i.e. all the upstream operators have only one child.

      • removeOperator

        public static void removeOperator(Operator<?> op)
        Remove operator from the tree, disconnecting it from its parents and children.

      • getOpNamePretty

        public static String getOpNamePretty(Operator<?> op)

      • isInBranch

        public static boolean isInBranch(SparkPartitionPruningSinkOperator op)
        Return true if contain branch otherwise return false
